response: narrative=Louise King, a 14-year-old, was reported missing from Dirleton Road and found at 1 Constitution Place, Leith Docks. She had been undergoing an identity crisis, leading her to spend time at an arcade with her colleagues. Rosie Williamson reported seeing Louise near 18 Queen Anne Drive shortly before she disappeared. It was revealed that Louise had been a patient at a mental health facility, which might have impacted her behavior. Concerned about her wellbeing, her colleague Jake Smith contacted authorities, emphasizing the importance of finding her. Louise was safely located by police.

narrative=Louise King, 17, was noted by those around her as experiencing an identity crisis, which seemed to heighten in intensity over recent weeks. On an ordinary evening, she was seen leaving her home on Dirleton Road after a heated exchange with her foster carer. Her departure led her to wander, eventually arriving at a rehabilitation center on the outskirts of town, a place she visited sporadically seeking solace. Simultaneously, a concerned colleague, Jake Smith, mentioned Louise had recently expressed feelings of disorientation relating to her self-identity. During her absence, there were reports of sightings at a factory near 69 Dirleton Avenue, North Berwick, EH39 4QL.
